nodes.text: Defeat the Dark Side

Defeat the Dark Side was a unified advertising campaign for three restaurants owned by Tricon Global—KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell—which went on before and during the release of the 1999 prequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace. It featured mascots from all three franchises at the time, involved in the events surrounding the Battle of Naboo.
Main characters
Harland Sanders

Colonel Harland Sanders is a spectacle-wearing human male who was born around 97 BBY. A known lightsaber-wielder and likely Force-sensitive, Sanders is known as a strong and determined individual and a fierce opponent of the dark side.
Sanders founded KFC, an establishment which serves buckets of chicken that are prepared under a secret recipe. Sanders serves in the Battle of Naboo alongside Pizza Hut Girl and the Chihuahua.
Pizza Hut Girl
The Human heroine known only as the Pizza Hut Girl is a slicer and martial arts expert.

Prior to joining the forces of Pizza Hut, she worked for Micro-Tech, Inc. as a "hardware tester" (a euphemism for "slicer"), and for 2-Rock Concert Promotions as "crowd control." Her studies took her to such far-flung locales as Hong Kong and Tunisia. She is the youngest female graduate of the Citadel.

At the age of 23, the Pizza Hut Girl has found her true calling, allowing both her mastery of Tae Kwon Do and her love for pizza to shine by working for Pizza Hut. There, she finds herself allied with Harland Sanders and the Chihuahua in an effort to defeat the dark side at the Battle of Naboo.
It is known that she has experience with blaster pistols.
The Chihuahua

The Chihuahua is a chihuahua dog fighting the dark side around the time of the Battle of Naboo. He devotes his life to the pursuit of tacos, and this dedication has allowed him to heighten his natural skills of navigation, negotiation, and deviousness. He battles the dark side because he rationalizes that when the universe is free, the tacos are free. He is working on mastering the Jedi mind trick.
Development

The campaign included seven television spots, toys and cup toppers available at the restaurants, a website, and a limited-time sweepstakes game. The sweepstakes game required visiting all three restaurants for a chance to win prizes such as a Lincoln Navigator vehicle, one million dollars, or a Star Wars hovercraft speeder.
Reception

According to Tricon Global's chairman and chief executive, Andrall Pearson, the tie-in marketing campaign was not effective at driving sales to the three restaurant chains and appeared to have stalled momentum from prior quarters. The failure was attributed to the market's supersaturation, with Star Wars merchandise available at many retailers in advance of the film. The campaign was reportedly considered a failure by Lucasfilm Ltd. as well, and they did not partner with Tricon for the next prequel film.
